newsitem.title: HONG KONG: CEPA shares rise on stake sale rumours.
newsitem.headline: CEPA shares rise on stake sale rumours.

text.p: Shares of Consolidated Electric Power Asia Ltd (CEPA) rose on rumours that its parent Hopewell Holdings Ltd might sell its CEPA stake at a premium to its trading price, brokers said on Wednesday.
"Rumours that Hopewell may sell its CEPA stake at a premium fueled buying interest," said Edwin Cheung, sales manager from Taiwan Securities.
CEPA shares rose HK$0.50 or 3.24 percent to HK$15.95 in midday trade on volume of HK$1.92 million shares.
Hopewell shares also rose HK$0.025 to HK$4.25 with 1.33 million shares changing hands.
Hong Kong Economic Journal reported on Wednesday that Hopewell was expected to announce its decision on selling part or all of its 60.4 percent stake in CEPA next week.
The companies officials were not immediately available for ceomment.
